description: Social work supervision is an important practice area that serves to enhance the competencies of social workers and ensure good clients’ outcomes. In ensuring good supervisory practice, the dynamics of personal, relational, organizational, socio-economical and cultural factors have to be considered. In this course, students will examine the knowledge and skills that social work supervisors need to address the challenges that may arise in the supervisory practice. A range of topics with broad themes based on the conceptualization of supervision and critical issues in supervision that are impacted by the organizational, socio-political contexts will be discussed.
title: Theory and Practice of Social Work Supervision
